forumNotes.author: Michele13
forumNotes.content:
![Posted Image](http://reboot.pro/index.php?app=downloads&module=display&section=screenshot&id=120)
**File Name** : BootMGR Installer  
**File Submitter** : [Michele13](http://reboot.pro/user/48914-michele13/ "")  
**File Submitted** : 02 Jan 2012  
**File Category** : [Boot tools](http://reboot.pro/files/category/7-boot-tools/ "")  

This packpage installs BootMGR in a Windows XP Machine and alllows you to make your own boot menu thanks to EasyBCD. Read [here](http://reboot.pro/16125/ "") for more details  

[Click here to download this file](http://reboot.pro/files/file/120-bootmgr-installer/ "")

forumNotes.author: sambul61
forumNotes.content:
Is that *EasyBCD* package you posted? If YES, why don't you name it by its real name? If NO, what's the difference?  

Are you its developer, or have a permission from its developer to post it without reference? ![:dubbio:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/dubbio.gif)  

Would be really nice to have some discussions with the *EasyBCD* developer on this forum about the tool...

forumNotes.author: paraglider
forumNotes.content: I would suspect that the same is also true for bootmgr

forumNotes.author: Michele13
forumNotes.content: I put together BOOTMGR and EasyBCD to make this packpage.
